content:
TITLE: Script Execution Command
DESCRIPTION: Command for running the main script with example generation parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python src/main.py --num_examples 1000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Python Dependencies for Alpaca Dataset Generator
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the required Python packages for the Alpaca Dataset Generator project. It includes libraries for deep learning (torch), NLP tasks (transformers, sentence-transformers, nltk), document processing (PyPDF2, python-docx), progress tracking (tqdm), and text tokenization (SentencePiece).
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/requirements.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
torch
transformers
sentence-transformers
nltk
PyPDF2
python-docx
tqdm
SentencePiece
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dependencies Installation
DESCRIPTION: Command for installing required Python packages from requirements.txt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: NLTK Data Download
DESCRIPTION: Command for downloading required NLTK data packages for text processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m nltk.downloader punkt stopwords
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Repository Clone and Setup
DESCRIPTION: Commands for cloning the repository and setting up the project environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator.git
cd alpaca-dataset-generator
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Virtual Environment Setup
DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating and activating a Python virtual environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows, use `venv\Scripts\activate`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Project Structure Overview
DESCRIPTION: Directory structure showing the organization of source code, data, and output files in the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
alpaca-dataset-generator/
│
├── src/
│   ├── main.py
│   ├── config.py
│   ├── data_loader.py
│   ├── model_setup.py
│   ├── dataset_generator.py
│   ├── validation.py
│   └── utils.py
│
├── data/
│   └── input/
│       ├── file1.txt
│       ├── file2.pdf
│       └── file3.docx
│
├── output/
│   ├── raw_dataset.jsonl
│   └── validated_dataset.jsonl
│
├── requirements.txt
└── README.md
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Markdown Structure
DESCRIPTION: Structured changelog entry for version 1.0.0 documenting the initial release features and capabilities of the Alpaca Dataset Generator.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ekatraone/alpaca-dataset-generator/blob/undefined/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## [1.0.0] - 2024-07-02

### Added
- Initial release of the Alpaca-style Dataset Generator
- Support for processing text, PDF, and Word documents as input
- Generation of diverse instruction types: summarize, keyword extraction, title generation, sentiment analysis, question generation, and paraphrasing
- Utilization of GPT-2, T5, and BERT models for different generation tasks
- Multithreaded input file processing for improved performance
- Command-line interface for easy usage
- Comprehensive README with setup and usage instructions

### Changed

### Deprecated

### Removed

### Fixed

### Security
```
